Five years in, what do we have today?

We need local input, we need votes in Congress, and we need to fix the #AntiquatedAntiquitiesAct.
I’m confident Dems and Republicans can work together to protect America’s natural heritage while also preserving its people’s way of life.
They live on in today’s generations who continue to carry on traditions and respect the lands they call home.
Rural Nevada’s culture, the will and resolve of its people, are not things that can be locked away in an outdoor museum.
At the end of the day, there is no doubt in my mind that the #AntiquitiesAct is a holdover of a bygone era.
#AntiquitiesAct is antiquated. It is a law rooted in the last century, and has been manipulated over the years to exceed its original intent
I wholeheartedly agree that we have a responsibility – we must protect what needs to be protected.
#Nevadans refuse to be lectured by those who feel they are first among equals in matters concerning our home.
Southeastern rural Nevada is in my blood. #NV04
Some wish to paint those who oppose this designation as enemies of our public lands, when nothing could be further from the truth.
I stand here again today to give a voice to what Nevada’s argument is, and what Nevada’s argument is not.
